titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Order No. 496
CWG11595

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, November 7th, 1863.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 496.

8. So much of Special Orders, No. 406, September 6th, 1863, from this Office, as discharged Assistant Surgeon Horace Babcock, 2d Kentucky Volunteers, on account of physical disability, and for absence without leave, is hereby amended as to omit the charge of absence without leave, he having furnished satisfactory evidence that he was absent by proper authority.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
Saml. Breck
Assistant Adjutant General.
